newsitem.title: USA: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 higher.
newsitem.headline: CSCE cocoa called to open $5 to $10 higher.

text.p: CSCE cocoa futures were called to open $5 to $10 higher Friday, in line with gains in London, traders said.

LIFFE futures rose sharply early Friday as traders followed through on Thursday's strong finish. At midsession, July cocoa was up 20 stg at 1,096 stg a tonne, and September was 17 stg higher at 1,013 stg.
Thursday, New York cocoa futures soared on talk that dry weather in Ivory Coast may be hampering early pod growth on the 1997/98 cocoa crop.
CSCE September settled up $57 at $1,571 a tonne after trading from $1,540 to $1,571. Spot July rose $52 to $1,523, while the outer months ended $55 to $56 higher.

Technically, September cocoa was likely to challenge a contract high set in April of $1,580. A gap carved out on September at the open stretching from $1,514-1,540 should offer solid support, traders said.
